title: Hudson Yards Developers See An Appetite for a Culinary Corridor
summary: The $25 billion mixed-use complex will be home to more than 20 dining and drinking spots. When Hudson Yards formally opens on March 15, the development will reshape the landscape in Manhattan's far west side, essentially introducing a new neighborhood teeming with office workers, residents and retail establishments.

title: The Saudis Hedge Their American Bets
summary: God may be great, but for Riyadh's strategic purposes, China's Xi Jinping apparently is greater.. It is, in its way, the most shocking spectacle in world politics since the Molotov-Ribbentrop pact between Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union: Even as Beijing is stepping up its persecution of Muslim Uighurs, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia cozied up to Chinese President Xi Jinping on his trip to China last week.

title: A Nobel Prize for Trump
summary: Alas, the Norwegians don't reward leaders who see a bad deal and walk away.. The ghosts of the Vietnam War haunt this week's summit between Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un, the North Korean leader formerly known as "Rocket Man." Especially since the talks are taking place in Hanoi and the specter of a Nobel Peace Prize is now hovering in the background.

title: The Obama-Trump Economic Boom
summary: The current expansion may soon be America's longest, and neither inflation nor tariffs are likely to stop it.. You'll soon be hearing a lot more from President Trump about the magnificent performance of the U.S. economy. That's because the long expansion that started in June 2009 is approaching, and will likely break, the all-time longevity record. It's all thanks to him, of course.

title: Cold Wash Espionage
summary: A dissident's fate for my Rolling Stones T-shirt at mom's KGB Laundry Service.. Teaching children to become responsible adults is a primary part of parenting. Getting them to do their own laundry is a good first step on the journey to independence, yet many parents fumble the handoff. I'm not really sure why: From fifth grade onward, I wanted to do my own laundry.

title: 'The Enlightened Capitalists' Review: Proﬁting From High Ideals
summary: One chief executive thought that if he could get his workers to want to succeed as much as he did, they would prosper together-and they did.. What is the responsibility of a business to its workers and its community? Amazon and New York City have recently offered very different answers, the tech giant proposing to create 25,000 jobs in return for a cool $3 billion in tax abatements, the city (or its progressive activists) demanding a better deal. Amazon's decision to abandon the project has merely ignited a broader debate. Proposals are flying around Congress to redirect the priorities of the private corporation-one might say, of capitalism itself.

title: Bad Science May Banish Paper Receipts
summary: California lawmakers seek a ban, based on a scare over BPA that was debunked two decades ago.. Having vanquished plastic straws, the California Legislature is now considering a bill to ban paper cash-register receipts. One reason offered for the ban is to reduce carbon-dioxide emissions. The other is to reduce public exposure to bisphenol A, or BPA, a chemical used to coat receipts.

title: Bernie Sanders Needs to Move Left
summary: He no longer stands out now that Democrats have all embraced his ideas.. Bernie Sanders is running again. He no longer faces a ferocious former first lady or a party apparatus stacked from top to bottom with her cronies. This time he faces a more daunting adversary: his own success. He nearly won the nomination in 2016, and he did win the party, even though he never formally joined it. The Clintonian "third way" counterrevolution is dead. Progressive voters are no longer a wing of the Democratic Party. They are its heart and soul.

title: The Nuclear Option Is the Real Green Deal
summary: A coal plant produces about as much toxic waste in an hour as a nuclear plant produces in a year.. If Americans want a "Green New Deal," they should try the nuclear option.

title: It Is the Year of More for CIOs: Pay, Workload and Influence Are on the Rise
summary: The growth of cloud-computing is freeing up CIOs to pursue business-side initiatives, analysts say. The role of chief information officers is expanding from providing backroom tech support to driving front-line business strategies, and often both at the same time, CIOs and industry analysts say.

title: Patients Face Monthslong Waits for New York Specialists
summary: Question of wait times comes as the city seeks to deliver health care to 600,000 uninsured and undocumented residents. New York City Health + Hospitals chief Mitchell Katz told members of the City Council during testimony Monday that wait times to see medical specialists at some of the city's public hospitals can stretch to months, depending on where a person seeks care and incremental staffing changes.

title: Dollar Weakens Against Emerging-Market Currencies as Trade Fears Ease
summary: Investors reacted to signs that the U.S. and China may be closer to a trade deal. The dollar fell against a broad range of emerging-market currencies Monday as investors reacted to signs that the U.S. and China may be closer to a trade deal.

title: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi Joins Amazon's Board
summary: Long-time Pepsi executive is second new board appointee at Amazon this month. Indra Nooyi, the former chief executive of PepsiCo Inc., has joined Amazon.com Inc.'s board of directors as the Seattle-based retail and technology giant continues its refresh of the panel.

title: GE's Asset Sales Bode Well for Balance Sheet
summary: Conglomerate's plan to sell some businesses to reduce debt will need to be balanced against the cuts such sales make in its ability to generate cash, analysts say. General Electric Co. 's strategy to shed noncore assets to pay down its debt could sap the company's future cash flows, but the move is expected to ultimately help stabilize its balance sheet and allow the company to focus on organic growth, analysts say.

title: Syria's Assad Visits Tehran, Looking to Cement Ties
summary: Iran, after backing the Syrian leader in a bloody 8-year war, seeks to expand its influence. TEHRAN, Iran-Syrian President Bashar al-Assad sought to boost economic ties with Iran as he met the country's leaders on Monday, his first public visit to a regional ally that has helped him reassert control over Syria after eight years of war.

title: Fed Officials Meet With Local Leaders to Support Low-Income Communities
summary: Amid monetary-policy review, central bank convenes listening tour to improve efforts to expand economic opportunity. DALLAS-Federal Reserve officials met with nonprofit and civic leaders here Monday to kick off a series of public listening sessions as the central bank reviews how it conducts monetary policy.

title: Trump Budget Proposal Would Protect Military From Steep Spending Cuts
summary: Proposal would use special contingency war fund for 'additional needed defense resources'. The Trump administration's top budget official said Monday the White House will propose capping next year's federal budget at spending levels enacted in 2011, while effectively exempting the Pentagon from the sharp spending cuts.

title: Investigators Search for Black Boxes in Amazon Plane Crash
summary: Investigators in Texas looked Sunday for cockpit voice and data recorders in the wreckage of a cargo plane flying for Amazon.com. Investigators in Texas searched Sunday for cockpit voice and data recorders in the wreckage of a cargo plane flying for Amazon.com Inc. that went into a sudden nosedive and crashed over the weekend, killing the three people on board.

title: Vandalism of Brooklyn Church's Statue Called a Hate Crime
summary: Authorities look for suspect who removed statue of Our Lady of Cisne in Park Slope, Brooklyn. The vandalism of a statue at a Roman Catholic church in Brooklyn last week was a hate crime, New York Police Department officials said Monday.

title: Mercedes Enlists Quantum Computing to Build a Better Electric Vehicle Battery
summary: Auto maker, working with IBM quantum experts, sees 'huge opportunity' in the technology. Mercedes-Benz's research and development division is researching how quantum computers could be used to discover new materials for advanced batteries in electric cars within the next decade.

title: New Jersey Moves Toward State-Sponsored Savings Program for Private-Sector Workers
summary: New Jersey will be sixth state to approve a program that requires many small businesses to offer retirement-savings plans. New Jersey lawmakers approved a measure Monday to create a state-sponsored savings program for private-sector employees, a move expected to sharply boost the number of New Jersey workers who have access to a retirement-savings plan.

title: Buffett: I Overpaid for Kraft Heinz
summary: Berkshire Hathaway doesn't plan to change its ownership stake in Kraft Heinz despite the struggles, he says. Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway Inc. and 3G Capital overpaid in 2015 when they helped form Kraft Heinz Co. , but he has no plans to sell.

title: World Trade Slowed at End of 2018
summary: Imports to and exports from China plummeted, signaling impact of U.S. tariffs. World trade fell at the end of last year as imports to and exports from China plummeted, a sign that higher tariffs and the threat of more to come are cooling global economic growth.

title: U.K. Labour Party Would Back Second Brexit Referendum
summary: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, previously lukewarm to fresh vote on U.K.'s exit from EU, changes course. LONDON-The U.K.'s main opposition Labour Party said it would support holding a second Brexit referendum, a policy shift that breathes some life into the prospect of Britons voting again on whether the U.K. should leave the European Union.

title: Who's Deplorable Now?
summary: Democrats wonder if they still need the Midwest.. It must be exhausting these days serving as a Democratic political operative. The party remains in a seemingly endless debate over how much to favor some demographic groups of American voters-and how much to punish others.

summary: Watching videos, loading Fortnite and downloading music is about to get a lot faster. Click on the image to see what faster 5G service will feel like in everyday life.

title: Buyer of AcuSport's Bankrupt Operations Sued Over Sale
summary: Lawyers winding down sporting goods chain says buyer hasn't paid transition costs. Lawyers working to pay off the final bills of bankrupt sporting goods distributor AcuSport Corp. have sued the South Carolina company that purchased its operations last year, saying the buyer broke its promise to cover more than $280,000 worth of transition costs.

title: Windstream Files for Bankruptcy After Legal Loss
summary: The filing follows an 18-month legal fight between the telecom company and Aurelius. Windstream Holdings Inc. filed for bankruptcy protection after losing a legal battle with hedge fund Aurelius Capital Management.

title: Former National Security Officials Challenge Trump's Emergency Declaration
summary: There is no justification for the action, say nearly 60 former officials in advance of congressional vote to reject the declaration. Nearly 60 prominent former national security officials released a statement Monday challenging President Trump's decision to invoke a national emergency to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, arguing the move isn't justified and that the claim of an emergency lacks a factual basis.

title: MTA Rebukes Contractors Over Railroad Project Delays
summary: Bombardier and Siemens missed a deadline for installing safety systems on Metro-North and the LIRR. Metropolitan Transportation Authority board members on Monday scolded contractors over significant delays to the installation of a safety system across the authority's commuter rail lines, placing it at risk of missing a federally mandated deadline.

title: Charitable Giving Shifts Toward Large Donations
summary: Report shows increase in larger gifts, early sign of how new tax law may be affecting nonprofit sector. WASHINGTON-Charitable giving in 2018 was increasingly concentrated among larger donors, according to a report released Monday, evidence of how the tax-code changes enacted in late 2017 are rippling through the nonprofit sector.

title: Trump's Retreat on Tariffs May Help Keep Inflation Pressure at Bay, Report Says
summary: If tariffs had created a jump in inflation pressures, it isn't clear how the Fed would have responded. President Trump's decision to delay expanded trade tariffs on Chinese imports likely staved off higher U.S. inflation, new research suggests.

summary: At the end of the 19th century, William-Adolphe Bouguereau was the most popular painter in the United States. Really?. Milwaukee

summary: The Academy Awards went off without any bloopers but in an age of near-limitless entertainment options, that's not enough to keep the show relevant. It was supposed to be a celebration of the best the motion-picture industry had to offer in 2018. But this year's Academy Awards felt more like an effort to just get through the night without bungling one more thing.

title: Madoff Trustee Wins Appeal on International Reach
summary: U.S. appeals court says some $4 billion in foreign transfers aren't immune from U.S. bankruptcy laws. The trustee cleaning up after Bernard Madoff's Ponzi scheme can recoup stolen money that passed between foreign banks and other firms, a federal appeals court said in a Monday ruling that broadens the international reach of U.S. bankruptcy laws.

title: No Men Allowed
summary: Can the University of California bar males from presenting research at a biology conference?. Next week the University of California, San Diego's prestigious Scripps Institution of Oceanography is the location for an intriguing academic conference. It's devoted to the microorganisms that exist on and within all of us. But participation by a much larger type of organism will be significantly restricted.

title: Stocks Pushed Higher by Tariff Delay
summary: Trade respite helps Chinese stocks to best day in years. U.S. stocks climbed Monday, following global indexes higher after President Trump said he would delay a planned increase in tariffs on Chinese goods.

title: PG&E Proposed Debt Trading Restrictions Set Off Protests
summary: Bondholders object to proposed trading limits designed to protect tax breaks. An indication from PG&E Corp. that it might restrict trading in its debt has set alarm bells ringing among distressed investing funds that have swarmed around the California utility's mega-billion-dollar bankruptcy case.

title: Too Cloudy for the Oracle
summary: Warren Buffett blames lack of understanding for quick exit from Oracle. When it comes to the cloud, even the Oracle of Omaha has a hard time seeing straight.

title: Vaping Helps Adults Quit Smoking but Encourages Teen Nicotine Addiction
summary: The popularity of e-cigarettes and the number of people age 13 to 17 who self-report becoming addicted to them, has skyrocketed.. title: Is Socialism the Bright Future Once Again?
summary: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez gives socialism a bad name.. Regarding Fred Barnes's "Ocasio-Cortez Heralds a New Political Era" (op-ed, Feb. 19): Mr. Barnes seems to misconstrue the difference between socialism and social democracies.

title: Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse Discloses Contributors, USCC Should, Too
summary: If the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and other anonymously funded groups that seek to influence the Court had to disclose their funders as I do, we could know who the real party in interest is behind these filings.. Regarding your editorial "No Friend-of-the-Court Senator" (Feb. 25): Justice Antonin Scalia wrote around the time of the 2010 Citizens United decision that disclosure is a necessary check on those seeking to influence government; without it, we aren't the "home of the brave." I am glad the Journal editorial board agrees with this principle when it comes to elected officials like me. I happily disclose my contributions. However, it is regrettable you abandon this principle when it comes to dark-money groups, whose amicus briefs have helped to trigger a cascade of 5-4 partisan decisions benefiting corporate-donor interests over the public at large.

title: Gov. Matthew Bevin: Kentucky Is Open for Business
summary: Kentucky also jumped from 39th to 23rd in overall business-tax climate. And we are just getting started.. With high regard for your publication and even higher regard for my friend, Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson, I am nonetheless compelled to address a significant oversight in your editorial "Arkansas Tax Cutters" (Feb. 9).

title: Prosecutors Detail Prostitution Solicitation Charges Against Robert Kraft
summary: Affidavit says the influential owner visited the day spa on Jan. 20, the same day the Patriots won the AFC Championship. A state attorney's office in Florida on Monday detailed prostitution solicitation charges against New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft, as the league said Mr. Kraft will be subject to the same discipline under the NFL's personal conduct policy as anyone else.

title: Trump Announces Release of a U.S. Citizen Who Was Held in Yemen
summary: Texas man, who worked for an oil company, was abducted in Yemen in 2017. WASHINGTON-A Texas man who was abducted in Yemen in 2017 has been reunited with his family, President Trump said Monday.

title: 'Walk Through Fire' by Yola Review: Across the Great Divide
summary: The unsung British singer's stunning roots pop album is a personal breakthrough that breaks boundaries. She's a physically commanding woman who possesses both a powerful, resonating voice and consummate singing savvy, and she's known simply as "Yola" now. She is 35, black, and was raised in Bristol, England. Since she started singing at age 5, she has performed with jazz bands, electronic dance music groups, and in country, roots rock and soul outfits. She has also appeared with her hometown's well-known Massive Attack under her given name, Yolanda Quartey. She first made an impression on this side of the Atlantic with appearances at Nashville's annual Americana Music festivals beginning in 2016. She was going by "Yola Carter" then and had still not become a household name back home.

title: New Jersey Lawmaker Aims to Expand Sexual-Assault Victims' Rights
summary: Loretta Weinberg wants to explore whether sexual-assault victims should be allowed to appeal when prosecutors decide not to present their cases to a grand jury. A top New Jersey lawmaker wants to give sexual-assault victims more options for pursuing criminal cases, including expanding their access to grand juries.

title: Treasurys Slip on China Tariff Delay
summary: U.S. government bonds fall as the danger of U.S. levies to global growth diminishes a bit. U.S. government-bond prices edged lower Monday after President Trump said he would delay a planned tariff increase on Chinese goods.

title: China Intends to Continue Debt-Reduction Efforts
summary: Regulator's comments come as Beijing has sharpened its rhetoric on economic risks. BEIJING--China's financial regulator pledged to continue debt-reduction efforts as Beijing sharpened its rhetoric against rising economic risks during a domestic slowdown.

title: Oil Falls After Trump Calls Crude Prices 'Too High'
summary: U.S. crude drops 3.1%, retreating from three-month high. • Oil prices had their worst day of the year Monday, falling sharply from a three-month high after President Trump said crude-oil prices are getting too high and could hurt the global economy.

title: Falling Stockpiles Help Unleash Industrial Metals Rally
summary: Copper, nickel and zinc are all up more than 10% this year, as a drop in inventories and a potential U.S.-China trade deal lift investor sentiment. Declining inventories and growing optimism about U.S.-China trade talks are fueling a rally in industrial metals such as copper-an encouraging sign for investors fretting over the global economy.

title: Copper Inches Lower After Trump Delays Tariff Increases
summary: Falling inventories amid slowing supply growth have given base metals support early in the year. Copper prices swung between small gains and losses before closing slightly lower Monday, hovering near their highest level since early July, after President Trump said he would delay an increase in tariffs on Chinese goods set to take effect at the end of this week.

title: CEOs Will Testify About Drug Prices
summary: Lawmakers are expected to pose questions about rebates and patents. Executives for some of the biggest pharmaceutical companies will visit Capitol Hill on Tuesday to face tough questions in a Senate hearing on the rising cost of medicines.

title: French Support for Yellow Vests Cools
summary: Decline in public backing for protest movement comes amid infighting and President Macron's improving approval ratings. PARIS-The French public has begun to turn against the yellow-vest movement, according to a new poll, in a fresh sign of relief for President Emmanuel Macron.

summary: Former Fed chief says she worries president's criticisms of the Fed could undermine confidence in it. Former Federal Reserve chairwoman Janet Yellen said in a radio interview that she didn't think President Trump understood economic policy or the mission of the Fed.

title: Bank of America to Drop Merrill Lynch Name From Some Businesses
summary: The bank will rebrand the bulk of its wealth-management business as simply Merrill; the trademark bull will remain in its logo. Mother Merrill is fading away.

summary: Sheldon Whitehouse doesn't disclose his own donors, while he tries to stifle other amicus briefs.. Sheldon Whitehouse is back, so hide the Constitution. The Rhode Island Senator was last spotted examining high school yearbooks to keep Brett Kavanaugh off the Supreme Court. Now the Democrat is trying to muzzle Americans trying to influence the High Court via legal arguments.

title: Holding Its Tongue on Democracy, EU Presses Arab Leaders to Stem Migration
summary: First-of-its-kind summit focused on curbing migrants, not on human rights. SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt-European Union officials used a first-of-its-kind summit here this week to press Arab leaders to create stability and stem migration but played down calls for democracy, reflecting a desire for calm after years of border tumult.

title: Little-Known, Inexpensive Reds Great for Winter Drinking
summary: When the weather is at its wintriest, a hearty red is the appropriate antidote. Our wine columnist explored some regions and grapes she'd been neglecting and found some superb values. WINTER SEEMS ENDLESS at this time of year, with the holidays long past or far in the future, depending on your point of view, but either way, it's fairly bleak. It is, however, an opportune time for some diversionary drinking, and there is nothing more appealing right now than a delicious, substantial red.

title: Russia's Baring Vostok Seeks Putin Intervention on Behalf of Detained Founder
summary: American founder Michael Calvey and three other employees are accused of embezzlement. Baring Vostok Capital Partners, one of Russia's oldest private-equity firms, on Monday called on Russian President Vladimir Putin to intervene in a criminal case concerning its American founder.

title: Why This Former NBA Champion Wants to Pay College Basketball Players
summary: David West is trying to launch the Historical Basketball League as an alternative to the NCAA; 'We need to create something fair.'. Then he got to the NBA and began reading more about the revenues generated by the NCAA tournament, which now exceed $1 billion annually.

title: Oscar in the Age of Entertainment Overload
summary: Audiences have more choices than ever before. For Hollywood, that might not be a good thing.. summary: Trump urges cartel to relax prices as Riyadh lobbies key allies Russia and Nigeria to honor pledged cuts. title: Trump Organization Details Level of Profits from Foreign Governments
summary: Company to donate $191,000 in the profits to Treasury. WASHINGTON-The Trump Organization said Monday that it had donated $191,000 in profits it received from foreign governments in 2018 to the U.S. Treasury, nearly 30% more than it reported the previous year.

summary: Voter shifts are causing ideological and policy whiplash. Sometimes the most momentous shifts in American life happen in plain sight, but in such slow motion that they aren't fully appreciated until complete.

summary: The sport can quantify just about everything nowadays-but it can't measure catcher Jeff Mathis, a lifetime .198 hitter who was one of the most sought after players in the free-agent market. title: A Chinese Broker for U.S. Stocks Seeks a Nasdaq Listing
summary: Owner of online-trading platform Tiger Brokers plans to raise up to $150 million in IPO. HONG KONG-One of China's largest and fastest-growing online brokerages filed plans to go public in New York, offering a window into the world of Chinese investors who are increasingly trading U.S.-listed stocks.

title: Battling Bans, China's Huawei Goes on an Advertising Offensive
summary: Chinese company looks to sway U.S. allies amid efforts to block it from rollouts of 5G networks on national-security concerns. As a challenge to key U.S. allies seeking to block it from rollouts of 5G networks, China's Huawei Technologies Co. unleashed an edgy ad campaign.

title: Apple's Deal With Goldman Has Wall Street on Defense
summary: Apple and Goldman need each other if they are going to burrow deeper into consumer banking. Apple Inc. executives came to a group of big banks in 2017 with a problem.

title: Surging Chinese Stocks Ride a Wave of Debt
summary: Margin lending to buy Chinese stocks is on the rise again, magnifying the rally sparked by hopes of a trade deal. China's armies of individual investors are back, and so is their habit of taking on debt to buy stocks. All but the most iron-stomached buyers should approach the latest market rally with caution.

title: Warren Passes on Big-Ticket Fundraisers in Primary Campaign
summary: Massachusetts senator's staff signals return to traditional tactics should she win the Democratic presidential nomination. WASHINGTON-Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren's campaign says she is forgoing traditional private fundraising dinners and receptions during her 2020 presidential primary bid, instead offering "equal access" to anyone who backs her.

title: Roadie Gains $37 Million to Expand Crowdsource Delivery Business
summary: Home Depot is among investors backing startup's bid to expand reach in retail services. Crowdsourced delivery company Roadie Inc. has raised $37 million in new funding that includes investment from Home Depot Inc., boosting dollars available for marketing efforts with big retailers and for building out its technology.

title: Lineage Logistics Buys Rival Preferred Freezer Services
summary: More than $1 billion acquisition combines world's No. 2 and No. 3 refrigerated warehouse providers. Lineage Logistics LLC, the second-largest refrigerated storage company in the world by space, is acquiring Preferred Freezer Services LLC, expanding its warehouse footprint in a sector driven by growing demand for rapid delivery of fresh foods to consumers.

title: Fed's Bostic Expects One Rate Rise This Year, Another in 2020
summary: Atlanta Federal Reserve chief Raphael Bostic said central bank's policy should let the U.S. economy 'stand on its own'. NEW YORK-Atlanta Fed leader Raphael Bostic is still on board with more central bank interest-rate increases, including one this year and one next year.

title: Avocados and Olives Cost More Because Fat Is In Fashion
summary: Fish farmers, butter producers and others are struggling to increase output as consumers eat more good fat. Farmers around the globe are struggling to keep up with an increasing global appetite for fats that are perceived as healthy, leading to long-term disruptions in food prices.

title: Europe Seeks Out New Frontiers in Space Race
summary: The continent is attempting to regain momentum after stalling amid budget restraints and competition from China and the U.S..

title: How to Score Trump's China Deal
summary: In any deal, investors should look for real economic reforms from Beijing-not just commitments to buy more U.S. goods. U.S. tariffs on $200 billion of imports from China were set to rise sharply next Saturday. Now President Trump, citing "substantial progress" during trade talks, says the increases are on hold. He hopes to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping to negotiate a sweeping accord.

title: Fashion on the Oscars Red Carpet
summary: A look at what movie stars and filmmakers wore on Hollywood's biggest night. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: 'Green Book' Wins Best Picture at the Academy Awards
summary: Olivia Colman in 'The Favourite' and Rami Malek in 'Bohemian Rhapsody' take the top acting prizes. Los Angeles

title: Chinese Stocks Jump After U.S. Postpones Tariff Increase
summary: The Shanghai Composite Index is at a seven-month high, while its counterpart in Shenzhen is poised to enter a bull market. Mainland Chinese shares surged Monday on signs of easing trade tensions with the U.S. and top-level support for the country's financial sector.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Season's Secret Ingredient: Maple Syrup
summary: At this sugar shack in rural Quebec, maple syrup brings a certain je ne sais quoi to every rustic, riotous meal. Bring the feast home with these deeply comforting recipes. OUTSIDE La Cabane d'à Côté, a restaurant less than an hour's drive from Montreal, a handful of guests, early for their reservation, kill time. They're sipping beers they've brought, chilling what remains of their six-packs in the snow. This cabane à sucre (French for "sugar shack") in St.-Benoît de Mirabel, Quebec, specializes in the uniquely regional feast that takes place during sugaring season, when the maple sap is flowing. It shows up in nearly every dish on the menu.

title: 2019 Academy Awards Winners
summary: Resume Subscription. A complete list of this year's winners at the 91st Academy Awards.

title: Are You a Confident or Overconfident Boss? Here's How to Tell
summary: Four questions to ask yourself to make sure cockiness isn't interfering with your-and your team's-performance.. Ask most people what traits make for great leaders, and self-confidence would almost certainly be near the top. The best managers not only act decisively, but draw on their confidence to support-and challenge-team members. These managers also instill confidence in their people-a near-impossible task if they don't model confidence themselves.

title: A CFO Who Had to Learn the Language of Finance
summary: Lloyd Howell says that when he was promoted to CFO, he rejected the fake-it-until-you-make-it approach. Instead, he leaned on others for advice.. When Lloyd Howell was promoted to chief financial officer of Booz Allen Hamilton Inc. in 2016, he knew he had a lot to learn. And he wasn't about to pretend otherwise.

title: Why CEOs Should (Almost) Never Pick Their Replacement
summary: Chief executives too often have a bias for preserving their legacy, rather than forging the right direction for the future. CEOs may be the leaders of their company, but when it comes to choosing a successor, they should take a back seat to the board.

title: Foot Locker's Game Plan to Win Over Sneakerheads
summary: The company says the key is using vast amount of data and being fast on its feet. Keeping up with customer-service expectations in the digital age takes more than tech know-how. Especially when the customers are young, tech-savvy "sneakerheads" who want tomorrow's shoes today-or even yesterday.

title: How Executives Can Balance the Long Term and Short Term
summary: A company's stock price should get a quick lift from greater employee engagement and development, while improved innovation and customer satisfaction should help over time. More than ever, those in the C-suite are being forced to think across two different time spans.

title: Trump to Delay Tariff Increases on Chinese Imports
summary: U.S. president cites substantial progress in trade negotiations. WASHINGTON-President Trump said Sunday he would delay an increase in tariffs on Chinese goods set to take effect at the end of this week, citing "substantial progress" on issues including intellectual property and technology transfer after a weekend of talks.

title: Bangladeshi Commandos Kill Man Suspected of Hijacking Flight to Dubai
summary: Suspect shoots at military commandos after Biman Bangladesh Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Chittagong. DHAKA, Bangladesh-A flight bound for Dubai from Bangladesh's capital, Dhaka, made an emergency landing Sunday in Chittagong, Bangladesh, after a man attempted to hijack the plane, officials said.

title: Eleven Popular Apps That Shared Data With Facebook
summary: Five have ceased doing so after being contacted by The Wall Street Journal. The Wall Street Journal's testing of over 70 applications that handle sensitive information turned up 11 that were sending at least some data to Facebook Inc. One had completely stopped doing so after being contacted by the Journal but before Friday's story. Since the report, four more have reduced or removed transfers of data to Facebook as well.

title: Newmont Says Rival Miner Barrick Gold Has Bought a Small Stake
summary: Barrick proposes to make it easier for Newmont stock owners to call a meeting, a move that comes ahead of a potential hostile bid. Newmont Mining Corp. said Sunday that rival miner Barrick Gold Corp. has taken a small stake in the company and proposed to make it easier for Newmont stock owners to call a shareholder meeting, a move that comes ahead of a potential hostile bid by the Canadian company.

title: Queens Activists Eye Opportunity as Democratic Party Boss Exits Post
summary: Crowley's resignation brings about the first leadership change in more than a decade. The resignation of former Rep. Joe Crowley as chairman of the Queens Democratic organization will bring about the first leadership change in more than a decade, and some officials in the borough hope, a chance for more openness.
